reviews.review_msg: She is generally a very nice and helpful person, and patient during office hours. The one thing that bothers me so much about her is that she can be so sarcastic. She has a general idea of each student's progress. I did bad on some of the labs, and she knew that too. So after the lab, she says to me "better luck next time!". Not my kind of gesture.

CHEM 121 Lab/CHEM 125 is a very tough lab for a 1st yr lab. Dr. Lunniss is very caring and really wants the class to do well. She creates a positive learning environment and is always willing to help. She's knowledgeable. You must do LON-CAPA and write sol'n in Lab Man. Pay attention to what the report sheet asks for you to do before going to lab
She was very kind and nice to talk to. She also gave useful demos throughout our labs and was always there to help regardless of how the question. Nothing negative to say about her or the course.
Really nice lab instructor. She explains things well and calls me "love".

Dropped the class because of the lecture portion which is absurdly hard, but the lab is actually not bad. She is very helpful within the lab and outside the lab, I would take her again every time. Best thing to do for your grade in the class is to ask question she explains concepts and techniques in the lab very well and doesn't get annoyed abt it.
One of the best lab teachers out there.
Pop quizzes where more about memorizing and not about the concepts we were learning. At some points, we would be doing labs on things we had not yet learned.

Julie is probably one of the sweetest, most kind, and caring human beings on the planet. She is incredibly patient and understanding of her students. The labs are easy to prepare for and the only real way to lose marks is by having small math mistakes throughout your lab reports.
Gives really great explanations, I asked a lot of questions and she always was ready and happy to answer them! Really sweet human overall, even though she throws pop quizzes at you

Lunniss is a great lab instructor, she is very approachable and really does want her students to understand the material.  My TA was a hot mess, so I often went to Julie if I needed to ask a question and got As on most of the lab reports. The labs often do have pop quizzes with a very short time limit, so doing the LONCAPA assignments is a must.

A super sweet person, she was always more than willing to answer any of my questions no matter how dumb. She didn't always give the exact answer, but put me on track to find it myself, which was great. Really nice atmosphere in this class. But do be ready for pop quizzes.
wow she was awsome. so helpful and so NOT intimidating. Shes totally like. . .FOR the students.

all the lab done in 7 weeks. It was a bit stressful...but Dr.Lunniss is the best. She's very friendly, approachable, and very helpful. Explains materials very well, and sometimes gave extra time because the lab was too long (waiting for equipments). Yup. Best prof I've ever met so far. Wish all the profs were like her...
